Here is the cdf of an absolutely continuous random variable $X$:

$$
F(x;\,\alpha,\,\theta)
=
\begin{cases}
1-\left(\frac{\theta}{x + \theta}\right)^\alpha & x >0 \\
0 & \text{else}.
\end{cases}
$$

The parameters $\alpha$ and $\theta$ are just positive constants.

a.  Find the pdf of $X$ and plot it for $\alpha=1,\, 2,\, 3$ and $\theta = 1$;
a.  Compute the median of $X$;
a.  Compute $E(X)$. Is it finite for all values of the parameters?
a.  Compute $\textrm{var}(X)$. Is it finite for all values of the parameters?
a.  Fix $(\alpha,\,\theta) = (3,\, 100)$ and compute $P(X > 75\,|\, X > 50)$.
